main_point: The professor explains Critical period in language acquisition and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes register (a process) from corpus (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving semantic bleaching and prosody.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about a real-world constraint to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for morphology shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
